about.title: Front-End
about.description: I’m a front-end developer from Vancouver, B.C. My passion is JavaScript, and I’m constantly learning new front-end technologies that enable me to build web applications with efficiency and organization. The challenge of learning something new excites me.

about.title: Back-End
about.description: I’m aquainted with back-end technologies, such as PHP, Laravel, MySQL. I have created custom CMS’s and CRUD applications. I am currently undertaking the learning of employing JavaScript for backend development.

about.title: Design
about.description: I have an appreciation for clean design that is communicative and simple to use. I understand that user experience is at the forefront of any application, and I’m constantly considering the user’s perspective during development.

about.title: Interests
about.description: I’m very dedicated to my work, but when I’m not sitting in front of a computer doing my thing, you’ll most likely find me enjoying the outdoors, listening to music, playing some sort of game, or trying something completely new.

works.name: Board Buddies
works.description: Social application for finding people to play board games with
details: This is a web application that connects individuals who are interested in playing board games, by enabling them to create and join board game events in their area. Our team of nine were all invested in making this idea a reality, as we felt that this was a need that our society was missing. As a member of the front-end developer team, I was tasked with creating an interface that was easy to use, efficient and reusable while in constant communication with the other members of the team.
role: Give feedback on designs from a user experience perspective. Develop the front end of web application based on mockups created by UX designer. Refactor code to be adhearing to best practices.
functionality: Filter events based on location, date and keywords. Post to a comment section. Join events. Google map integration with React

works.name: Exotic Typography
details: A school project website made for a mock typography studio. 48 hours to design and develop. Features a custom coded CMS. Fully responsive.
role: Research the target market and competitors. Create wireframes and mockups to satisfy the company goals. Develop a responsive website that follows the mockups.
functionality: Compare typography styles. Custom CMS made from scratch Image slider. Customized map.

works.name: Alexandra Hernandez
works.description: A portfolio website for a Game Artist
details: A school project website made for a mock typography studio. 48 hours to design and develop. Features a custom coded CMS. Fully responsive.
role: Design mockup that follows design direction of the client. Develop a pixel perfect custom theme in wordpress.
functionality: A fully customizable site using Wordpress

works.name: VanArts Radio
works.description: A website created for the promotion of the VanArts radio station
details:
A website created for the Broadcasting & Online Media program at VanArts to promote their radio station that is hosted at Mixlr. This website began as a school project, where I was tasked with creating a custom CMS. 
 The program was previously using a Wordpress site and was interested in getting this site imported to Wordpress, so I was tasked with learning how to import a custom theme into Wordpress.
role: Research competitor radio stations in the local area. Design and develop website that adheres to client's goals.
functionality: Access to Mixlr radio station. Animations for loading. Customized backend. Refactor into wordpress theme.
